channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: MuGI: Enhancing Information Retrieval through Multi-Text Generation Intergration with Large Language Models
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have emerged as a pivotal force in language technology.

item.title: Effects of diversity incentives on sample diversity and downstream model performance in LLM-based text augmentation
item.description: The latest generative large language models (LLMs) have found their application in data augmentation tasks, where small numbers of text samples are LLM-paraphrased and then used to fine-tune the model.

item.title: INTERS: Unlocking the Power of Large Language Models in Search with Instruction Tuning
item.description: Despite this, their application to information retrieval (IR) tasks is still challenging due to the infrequent occurrence of many IR-specific concepts in natural language.

item.title: Machine Translation Models are Zero-Shot Detectors of Translation Direction
item.description: Detecting the translation direction of parallel text has applications for machine translation training and evaluation, but also has forensic applications such as resolving plagiarism or forgery allegations.

item.title: Mutual Distillation Learning For Person Re-Identification
item.description: With the rapid advancements in deep learning technologies, person re-identification (ReID) has witnessed remarkable performance improvements.

item.title: Valid causal inference with unobserved confounding in high-dimensional settings
item.description: We propose uncertainty intervals which allow for unobserved confounding, and show that the resulting inference is valid when the amount of unobserved confounding is small relative to the sample size; the latter is formalized in terms of convergence rates.

item.title: RotationDrag: Point-based Image Editing with Rotated Diffusion Features
item.description: Our method tracks handle points more precisely by utilizing the feature map of the rotated images, thus ensuring precise optimization and high image fidelity.

item.title: Scalable 3D Panoptic Segmentation With Superpoint Graph Clustering
item.description: We introduce a highly efficient method for panoptic segmentation of large 3D point clouds by redefining this task as a scalable graph clustering problem.

item.title: AboutMe: Using Self-Descriptions in Webpages to Document the Effects of English Pretraining Data Filters
item.description: Large language models' (LLMs) abilities are drawn from their pretraining data, and model development begins with data curation.

item.title: Sanity Checks Revisited: An Exploration to Repair the Model Parameter Randomisation Test
item.description: The Model Parameter Randomisation Test (MPRT) is widely acknowledged in the eXplainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI) community for its well-motivated evaluative principle: that the explanation function should be sensitive to changes in the parameters of the model function.

item.title: Automated Machine Learning for Positive-Unlabelled Learning
item.description: Positive-Unlabelled (PU) learning is a growing field of machine learning that aims to learn classifiers from data consisting of labelled positive and unlabelled instances, which can be in reality positive or negative, but whose label is unknown.

item.title: Multi-Candidate Speculative Decoding
item.description: One way to speed them up is speculative decoding, which generates candidate segments (a sequence of tokens) from a fast draft model that is then verified in parallel by the target model.

item.title: Ada-Retrieval: An Adaptive Multi-Round Retrieval Paradigm for Sequential Recommendations
item.description: However, most existing retrieval models employ a single-round inference paradigm, which may not adequately capture the dynamic nature of user preferences and stuck in one area in the item space.

item.title: Graph Relation Distillation for Efficient Biomedical Instance Segmentation
item.description: IGD constructs a graph representing instance features and relations, transferring these two types of knowledge by enforcing instance graph consistency.

item.title: Kun: Answer Polishment for Chinese Self-Alignment with Instruction Back-Translation
item.description: In this paper, we introduce Kun, a novel approach for creating high-quality instruction-tuning datasets for large language models (LLMs) without relying on manual annotations.

item.title: MetaHate: A Dataset for Unifying Efforts on Hate Speech Detection
item.description: Hate speech represents a pervasive and detrimental form of online discourse, often manifested through an array of slurs, from hateful tweets to defamatory posts.

item.title: Self-supervised Learning of Dense Hierarchical Representations for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: This paper demonstrates a self-supervised framework for learning voxel-wise coarse-to-fine representations tailored for dense downstream tasks.

item.title: From Automation to Augmentation: Large Language Models Elevating Essay Scoring Landscape
item.description: Receiving immediate and personalized feedback is crucial for second-language learners, and Automated Essay Scoring (AES) systems are a vital resource when human instructors are unavailable.

item.title: Exploring Diverse Representations for Open Set Recognition
item.description: We show that the differences in attention maps can lead to diverse representations so that the fused representations can well handle the open space.

item.title: Frequency Masking for Universal Deepfake Detection
item.description: We study spatial and frequency domain masking in training deepfake detectors.

item.title: DQNC2S: DQN-based Cross-stream Crisis event Summarizer
item.description: Summarizing multiple disaster-relevant data streams simultaneously is particularly challenging as existing Retrieve&Re-ranking strategies suffer from the inherent redundancy of multi-stream data and limited scalability in a multi-query setting.

item.title: Adaptive Data Augmentation for Aspect Sentiment Quad Prediction
item.description: Aspect sentiment quad prediction (ASQP) aims to predict the quad sentiment elements for a given sentence, which is a critical task in the field of aspect-based sentiment analysis.

item.title: Temporal and Between-Group Variability in College Dropout Prediction
item.description: Large-scale administrative data is a common input in early warning systems for college dropout in higher education.

item.title: Prometheus-Vision: Vision-Language Model as a Judge for Fine-Grained Evaluation
item.description: Assessing long-form responses generated by Vision-Language Models (VLMs) is challenging.

item.title: Proximal Causal Inference With Text Data
item.description: Recent text-based causal methods attempt to mitigate confounding bias by including unstructured text data as proxies of confounding variables that are partially or imperfectly measured.

item.title: Block Majorization Minimization with Extrapolation and Application to $Î²$-NMF
item.description: We propose a Block Majorization Minimization method with Extrapolation (BMMe) for solving a class of multi-convex optimization problems.

item.title: Seeing the roads through the trees: A benchmark for modeling spatial dependencies with aerial imagery
item.description: In this work we propose a road segmentation benchmark dataset, Chesapeake Roads Spatial Context (RSC), for evaluating the spatial long-range context understanding of geospatial machine learning models and show how commonly used semantic segmentation models can fail at this task.

item.title: Improving the Detection of Small Oriented Objects in Aerial Images
item.description: Small oriented objects that represent tiny pixel-area in large-scale aerial images are difficult to detect due to their size and orientation.

item.title: Every Node is Different: Dynamically Fusing Self-Supervised Tasks for Attributed Graph Clustering
item.description: In this paper, we propose to dynamically learn the weights of SSL tasks for different nodes and fuse the embeddings learned from different SSL tasks to boost performance.

item.title: Uncertainty quantification for probabilistic machine learning in earth observation using conformal prediction
item.description: Unreliable predictions can occur when using artificial intelligence (AI) systems with negative consequences for downstream applications, particularly when employed for decision-making.

item.title: The Unreasonable Effectiveness of Easy Training Data for Hard Tasks
item.description: In this paper, we present the surprising conclusion that current language models often generalize relatively well from easy to hard data, even performing as well as "oracle" models trained on hard data.

item.title: Personalized Reinforcement Learning with a Budget of Policies
item.description: In an r-MDP, we cater to a diverse user population, each with unique preferences, through interaction with a small set of representative policies.

item.title: Efficient Image Deblurring Networks based on Diffusion Models
item.description: This article introduces a sliding window model for defocus deblurring that achieves the best performance to date with extremely low memory usage.

item.title: Wavelet-Inspired Multiscale Graph Convolutional Recurrent Network for Traffic Forecasting
item.description: Traffic forecasting is the foundation for intelligent transportation systems.

item.title: CAT-LLM: Prompting Large Language Models with Text Style Definition for Chinese Article-style Transfer
item.description: Text style transfer is increasingly prominent in online entertainment and social media.

item.title: End-to-end Learnable Clustering for Intent Learning in Recommendation
item.description: Firstly, the separation of representation learning and clustering optimization within a generalized expectation maximization (EM) framework often results in sub-optimal performance.

item.title: Surgical-DINO: Adapter Learning of Foundation Models for Depth Estimation in Endoscopic Surgery
item.description: There is clear evidence in the results that zero-shot prediction on pre-trained weights in computer vision datasets or naive fine-tuning is not sufficient to use the foundation model in the surgical domain directly.

item.title: Universal Vulnerabilities in Large Language Models: In-context Learning Backdoor Attacks
item.description: Extensive experimental results across several language models, ranging in size from 1. 3B to 40B parameters, demonstrate the effectiveness of our attack method, exemplified by a high average attack success rate of 95. 0% across the three datasets on OPT models.

item.title: Knowledge Translation: A New Pathway for Model Compression
item.description: Deep learning has witnessed significant advancements in recent years at the cost of increasing training, inference, and model storage overhead.

item.title: Prediction of Cellular Identities from Trajectory and Cell Fate Information
item.description: Determining cell identities in imaging sequences is an important yet challenging task.

item.title: Safe reinforcement learning in uncertain contexts
item.description: In this work, we drop this assumption and show how we can perform safe learning when we cannot directly measure the context variables.

item.title: Extreme Compression of Large Language Models via Additive Quantization
item.description: The emergence of accurate open large language models (LLMs) has led to a race towards quantization techniques for such models enabling execution on end-user devices.

item.title: On Detecting Cherry-picking in News Coverage Using Large Language Models
item.description: This study introduces Cherry, an innovative approach for automatically detecting cherry-picked statements in news articles by finding missing important statements in the target news story.

item.title: Cheetah: Bridging the Gap Between Machine Learning and Particle Accelerator Physics with High-Speed, Differentiable Simulations
item.description: Machine learning has emerged as a powerful solution to the modern challenges in accelerator physics.

item.title: The Benefits of a Concise Chain of Thought on Problem-Solving in Large Language Models
item.description: We evaluated this using GPT-3. 5 and GPT-4 with a multiple-choice question-and-answer (MCQA) benchmark.

item.title: Manipulating Feature Visualizations with Gradient Slingshots
item.description: Deep Neural Networks (DNNs) are capable of learning complex and versatile representations, however, the semantic nature of the learned concepts remains unknown.

item.title: Enhancing Personality Recognition in Dialogue by Data Augmentation and Heterogeneous Conversational Graph Networks
item.description: Personality recognition is useful for enhancing robots' ability to tailor user-adaptive responses, thus fostering rich human-robot interactions.

item.title: DeepSeekMoE: Towards Ultimate Expert Specialization in Mixture-of-Experts Language Models
item.description: Subsequently, we scale up DeepSeekMoE to 16B parameters and show that it achieves comparable performance with LLaMA2 7B, with only about 40% of computations.

item.title: Cross-modal Retrieval for Knowledge-based Visual Question Answering
item.description: Knowledge-based Visual Question Answering about Named Entities is a challenging task that requires retrieving information from a multimodal Knowledge Base.

item.title: Towards Boosting Many-to-Many Multilingual Machine Translation with Large Language Models
item.description: The training paradigm for machine translation has gradually shifted, from learning neural machine translation (NMT) models with extensive parallel corpora to instruction finetuning on pretrained multilingual large language models (LLMs) with high-quality translation pairs.
